title: Where did Henry David Thoreau live, and what did he live for? - Quora
tags: History of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Henry David Thoreau lived in a cabin outside of Concord, Massachusetts, which is a short commuter train ride from Boston. He was a protege of Emerson, involved in the Transcendentalist movement of the early to mid 1800s. An outspoken opponent of America’s aggressive war against Mexico, he also advocated for a simple life of deep reflection and direct interaction with natural forces. His famous works include On Walden Pond and Civil Disobedience.
